result.execSummary:
The defendant Devin J Puckett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court
Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.
Probation may be transferred to the State of Georgia.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

No Contact with co-defendants. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. 
Not to possess any checks or checking account (unless it is a payroll check issued to him from his employer)
NOT to leave the State of Georgia unless approved by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours with standard release conditions. LAST 57 Days are Stayed for use at agent's discretion. Sentence credit of 123 days were granted.

charges.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

records.addlTxt: Letter from Judge Carter to Attorney Jessica Klein in response to her letter dated 9/10/15
Letter from Attorney Jessica Klein to the court regarding Defendant not being able to leave Wisconsin after sentencing due to needing to report to probation and parole.

Defendant Devin J Puckett in court, in custody, with Attorney Jessica Klein.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Statements made by Attorney Klein regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

3 1/2 YEARS IMPRISONMENT 
  -  18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -   2 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS     **TRANSFER ALLOWED TO STATE OF GEORGIA**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: Co-Defendants
____Not to use or possess any checks or checking account (unless payroll check issued to him from his employer)
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
____Not to leave state of Georgia unless agent approves

COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  180 Days, (123 Days credit)  Non-working hours with standard release conditions  -  LAST 57 Days STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is  eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Dated 08/27/15, from Atty Klein to Judge Carter, character letter attached.
Sentencing hearing on August 31, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
(Fax) Dated 08/06/15, from Atty Klein to Judge Carter, giving notice that the parties are jointly recommending to waive a PSI.
Sentencing hearing on October 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Devin J Puckett in court, in custody, with attorney Jessica Klein.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count 1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Counts 2-8 are dismissed and read in.  Court orders PSI.  Court sets sentencing date. Bail remains as fixed. Attorney Klein moves to waive the PSI.  Court withholds ordering of PSI so Attorney Klein can confer with the State.  PSI will be ordered on 8/7/2015 if Court does not hear different from Attorney Klein.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Plea hearing on July 30, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Devin Puckett in court, in custody, with Attorney Jessica Klein.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This case is called with Case #15CF539, 15CF544, 15CF545 and 15CF546.  All attorneys on all cases are present (Attorney Kirk Redetzke appears by telephone).   Court advises all parties of anticipated timeline for jury trial commencing on Monday, August 10, 2015.  Court orders counsels to submit proposed jury instructions to the court by 8/6/15 status date.  Court orders/requests all counsel to submit their proposed questions to jury panel by 8/6/15, as well as an approximate estimate of time on opening/closing statements.  Court states all exhibits should be marked before jury trial and requests parties to use projector/doc cam to show exhibits during trial.  Court reminds parties to provide street clothes for their clients for trial day (days).

Defendant Devin J Puckett in court, in custody, with Attorney Jessica Klein.  Lucas Paul Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for oral ruling regarding motion for severance. Court denies motion to sever for reasons stated on the record.    Bail remains as fixed.   Previous court dates set remain on.
Hearing on July 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jessica Klein in court, defendant Devin J Puckett not in court, in custody.  Michele W. Hulgaard and Lucas Paul Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court will allow the Defense to respond to submission by July 6, 2015. Court will schedule for oral ruling. Bail remains as fixed.  Oral ruling scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 11:00 am.  Check Case scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Devin J Puckett in court, in custody, with attorney Jessica Klein.   Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Devin J Puckett in court, in custody, with attorney Jessica Klein.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case called for preliminary hearing with 15CF539 and 15CF541.  Village of Elm Grove Assistant Police Chief Jason Hennen sworn and testifies on direct by Attorney Nickolie.  Cross examination by Attorney Sonderhouse.  Cross examination by Attorney Rider.  Cross examination by Attorney Klein.  Village of Elm Grove Detective Craig Mayer sworn and testifies on direct by Attorney Nickolie.  Cross examination by Attorney Sonderhouse.  Cross examination by Attorney Rider.  Cross examination by Attorney Klein.  State rests and moves for bind over.  Defense moves for dismissal.   Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Bail remains as fixed.  Arraignment scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Atty Klein has been retained.
Preliminary hearing on May 13, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
